page.title: 08MEDIA
page.content: Obviously{Television}is a much appreciated asset during the long,hard and isolated winters. This is doubly so as reception is difficult to obtain due to the screening effect of the high surrounding hills. Most houses are connected to a privately owned television aerial that is placed in some high position on the surrounding moors and then cabled down to the various houses. These schemes (of which there are 6) were organised, financed and individually dug in across the moors by the residents concerned. {Radio reception}may also be variable. {Newspapers}are delivered to Abbey Stores from where they may be collected. A number of people have {videos,}as these are useful when reception is poor.
